docs.title: Urbano Versions
docs.text:
The Grasshopper plugin currently exists in two versions, please see below.

  • Urbano v1

    Our initial release, currently not maintained.

    Learn more

  • Urbano v2

    Our current release, currently actively maintained.

    Learn more

docs.title: Urbano v1
docs.text: More soon.

docs.title: ADP Trip Engine
docs.text: Generate trips from the building based on the given activity demand profile and the destination choice model for each activity in the profile

docs.title: Model []
docs.text: Urbano model containing buildings with amenities and network

docs.title: Bldg []
docs.text: Building as origin of trips

docs.title: ADPer []
docs.text: Activity Demand Profile (trips are produced for each activity entry in the profile

docs.title: Mode []
docs.text: Travel mode for the trips

docs.title: DestChoice []
docs.text: Destination choice model for each activity. It defines whether to produce one or multiple trips per activity in the ADP

docs.title: FacKey []
docs.text: A necessary input for By-Destination-Factor model. Please ensure the input/selected metadata keys are existing in the model.

docs.title: TimeLmt []
docs.text: A necessary input for By-Destination-Factor model. It defines the travel time limit when searching for the available destinations.

docs.title: Build []
docs.text: Toggle to start building Urbano model

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: Check Hydra Example Files for ADP Trip Engine

docs.title: Trips
docs.text: Trips generated by the engine according to the ADP

docs.title: Activity Demand Profile / Persona
docs.text: Activity Demand Profile describing the population weighted demand of activities for a certain persona type. Either input profile data, or load from stock data provided by Urbano. Loaded data can then be edited and saved in the ADP editor. You can even start creating a profile from scratch in the editor

docs.title: ActDem []
docs.text: Activities and their corresponding weights in comma separated lists

docs.title: Load []
docs.text: Load Activity Demand Profile data in CSV format from the dropdown / File Path / URL

docs.title: Index []
docs.text: One-based index for the column to use if the ADP data includes multiple columns (normally to indicate different time intervals)

docs.title: Norm []
docs.text: Normalize the demand weights to sum to 1

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: Check Hydra Example Files for Activity Demand Profile / Persona

docs.title: ADPer
docs.text: Activity Demand Profile describing the weighted demand of activities of a certain persona type

docs.title: Amenity Capacity
docs.text: Calculate amenity capacity based on the area and activity

docs.title: Act []
docs.text: Activity conducted in the amenity

docs.title: Area []
docs.text: Built area of the amenity, assign -1 to use default area for the activity

docs.title: LogProp []
docs.text: Logistics area proportion of the amenity, default = 0.2

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: Check Hydra Example Files for Amenity Capacity

docs.title: Meta
docs.text: Metadata containing the "ameinty_capacity" value (deconstruct to use the value itself)

docs.title: Amenity Hits
docs.text: Hits at amenities in the given trips

docs.title: Trips []
docs.text: Trips that are used to compute hits

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: Check Hydra Example Files for Amenity Hits

docs.title: Amen
docs.text: Amenity hosting certain activities for people to do

docs.title: AmHits
docs.text: A counter that tallies up the total number of people that are sent to a certain amenity on all trips

docs.title: AmHosts
docs.text: Amenity Hosts

docs.title: AmTrips
docs.text: Trips that were to that amenity

docs.title: Arrange Amenities By Building
docs.text: Arrange points (amenities, geotagged metadata from other sources) by the closest building

docs.title: Amens []
docs.text: List of amenities represented by points with metadata embedded (can be plain points too for just arranging)

docs.title: Bldgs []
docs.text: Building footprints to examine and place points into

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: Check Hydra Example Files for Arrange Amenities By Building

docs.title: AmenB
docs.text: List of amenities for each building

docs.title: Bldgs
docs.text: Same Buildings in order

docs.title: Build Urbano Model
docs.text: Build an Urbano model with buildings and streets

docs.title: Bldgs []
docs.text: Building curves in the model

docs.title: Net []
docs.text: Street Network

docs.title: Build []
docs.text: Toggle to start building Urbano model

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: Check Hydra Example Files for Build Urbano Model

docs.title: Model
docs.text: Urbano model containing buildings with amenities and network

docs.title: Bldgs
docs.text: Curves representing buildings in the Urbano model

docs.title: Acts
docs.text: Activities for which amenities are present in the Urbano model

docs.title: Building Hits
docs.text: Buildings that were destination for the given trips

docs.title: Trips []
docs.text: Trips that are used to compute hits

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: Check Hydra Example Files for Building Hits

docs.title: BldgCrv
docs.text: Destination Buildings curves

docs.title: BldgHits
docs.text: Building hits - number of people  that took trips to that building

docs.title: BldgTrips
docs.text: Trips that go to that building

docs.title: Building Population
docs.text: Calculate the population in a building using area data

docs.title: ResArea []
docs.text: Residential area of building (will be 0 if not assigned)

docs.title: RAreaPP []
docs.text: Residential area per person, default = 40

docs.title: OffArea []
docs.text: Office area of building (will be 0 if not assigned)

docs.title: OAreaPP []
docs.text: Office area per person, default = 14

docs.title: LogProp []
docs.text: Logistics area proportion of the building, default = 0.2

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: Check Hydra Example Files for Building Population

docs.title: PopMeta
docs.text: Metadata containing population data for a building (can merge with building metadata before creating building)

docs.title: Create Amenity
docs.text: Build amenity from point and metadata

docs.title: Pt []
docs.text: Point representing location of amenity

docs.title: Meta []
docs.text: Serializable dictionary with string keys and arbitrary values

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: Check Hydra Example Files for Create Amenity

docs.title: Amen
docs.text: Point with amenity metadata embedded

docs.title: Create Building
docs.text: Create a building with given curve and metadata.

docs.title: Curve []
docs.text: Closed polygon for the building footprint

docs.title: Meta []
docs.text: Serializable dictionary with string keys and arbitrary values

docs.title: AmenB []
docs.text: List of amenities for each building (optional)

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: Check Hydra Example Files for Create Building

docs.title: Bldg
docs.text: Building curve with metadata and amenities embedded

docs.title: Create Metadata
docs.text: Create metadata from field names (keys) and corresponding values.

docs.title: Keys []
docs.text: Field names (keys) in the metadata

docs.title: Vals []
docs.text: Values corresponding to keys in the metadata

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: Check Hydra Example Files for Create Metadata

docs.title: Meta
docs.text: Serializable dictionary with string keys and arbitrary values

docs.title: StCrvs []
docs.text: Curves represting streets in the network

docs.title: Meta []
docs.text: Serializable dictionary with string keys and arbitrary values

docs.title: Split []
docs.text: Preprocessing: split the street curves to get more  accurate routing results

docs.title: UTM []
docs.text: UTM Zone of the given region (can be used along with translation vector) to transform data from different sources to a common origin)

docs.title: Vec []
docs.text: Translation vector to move from actual UTM window to working origin (can be used to transform data from different sources to a common origin)

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: Check Hydra Example Files for Create Street Network

docs.title: Net
docs.text: Street Network

docs.title: Streets
docs.text: Processed street curves from the network

docs.title: UTM
docs.text: UTM Zone of the given region (can be used along with translation vector) to transform data from different sources to a common origin)

docs.title: Vec
docs.text: Translation vector to move from actual UTM window to working origin (can be used to transform data from different sources to a common origin)

docs.title: Deconstruct Metadata
docs.text: Deconstruct Metadata into keys and values

docs.title: Meta []
docs.text: Serializable dictionary with string keys and arbitrary values

docs.title: Keys
docs.text: Keys in metadata

docs.title: Download DEM and Build Terrain Mesh
Download DEM and Build Terrain Mesh
docs.text: Download the DEM data and build the terrain mesh (Allow administrator access for Rhino; Wait until the download to be completed in the background and re-enable this component to see the changes)

docs.title: Left []
docs.text: Left Bound (Longitude, x-axis) of the site

docs.title: Right []
docs.text: Right Bound (Longitude, x-axis) of the site

docs.title: Top []
docs.text: Top Bound (Latitude, y-axis) of the site

docs.title: Bottom []
docs.text: Bottom Bound (Latitude, y-axis) of the site

docs.title: UTM []
docs.text: UTM Zone of the given region (can be used along with translation vector) to transform data from different sources to a common origin)

docs.title: Vec []
docs.text: Translation vector to move from actual UTM window to working origin (can be used to transform data from different sources to a common origin)

docs.title: X Count []
docs.text: Count of mesh vertices on X axis

docs.title: Y Count []
docs.text: Count of mesh vertices on Y axis

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: Check Hydra Example Files for Download DEM and Build Terrain Mesh

docs.title: mesh
docs.text: Terrain mesh constructed based on the DEM data (data resource: https://dds.cr.usgs.gov/srtm/version2_1/SRTM3/)

docs.title: UTM
docs.text: UTM Zone of the given region (can be used along with translation vector) to transform data from different sources to a common origin)

docs.title: Vec
docs.text: Translation vector to move from actual UTM window to working origin (can be used to transform data from different sources to a common origin)

docs.title: Download OpenStreetMap(OSM)
docs.text: Download all OSM data within given bounds (be careful with the size of the region). OSM data will be downloaded to a cache and accessible by using the URL as input to import components. Providing the file path input will copy the data to the given location and can then be used to import later

docs.title: Left []
docs.text: Left Bound (Longitude, x-axis) of the OSM region

docs.title: Right []
docs.text: Right Bound (Longitude, x-axis) of the OSM region

docs.title: Top []
docs.text: Top Bound (Latitude, y-axis) of the OSM region

docs.title: Bottom []
docs.text: Bottom Bound (Latitude, y-axis) of the OSM region

docs.title: Path []
docs.text: File path to save downloaded OSM data to (optional - can use URL as path to import because of cached downloads)

docs.title: Run []
docs.text: Toggle to start downloading OSM data

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: Check Hydra Example Files for Download OpenStreetMap(OSM)

docs.title: URL
docs.text: URL used to download data (can use URL as path to import features, network, etc. because of cached downloads)

docs.title: File
docs.text: Path to downloaded OSM file

docs.title: Import LAS
docs.text: Import LAS file. (This component requires to run Rhino as administrator)

docs.title: Path []
docs.text: Specify the path to the Las file (.las)

docs.title: EPSG []
docs.text: Specify the EPSG of the coordinate reference system

docs.title: Proj []
docs.text: Project geograhic points from source file to UTM (rhino canvas) or WSG84 (lon,lat)

docs.title: Unit []
docs.text: Distance Unit

docs.title: Sparsity []
docs.text: Sparsity of the imported points. The larger the number is, the sparser the points are.

docs.title: UTM []
docs.text: UTM Zone of the given region (can be used along with translation vector) to transform data from different sources to a common origin)

docs.title: Vec []
docs.text: Translation vector to move from actual UTM window to working origin (can be used to transform data from different sources to a common origin)

docs.title: Left []
docs.text: Left Bound (minimum longitude) of the cropped LAS region

docs.title: Right []
docs.text: Right Bound (maximum longitude) of the cropped LAS region

docs.title: Top []
docs.text: Top Bound (maximum latitude) of the cropped LAS region

docs.title: Bottom []
docs.text: Bottom Bound (minimum latitude) of the cropped LAS region

docs.title: Crop []
docs.text: Cropping Geometry

docs.title: Trip Amenityscore
docs.text: Amenityscore computed for the amenities based on the given trips. 'Amenityscore = 0' indicates the balance between the footfall and the capacity (Amenityscore = Amenity Hits / Amenity Capacity - 1).
